intro: Dipteropeltis macrantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical study.
